channel.title: Global Item Spawns on every level?
channel.description: FIXED!!! PM me to know how (hyperion)

item.title: Global Item Spawns on every level?
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:10, topic:537968”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=656794.msg4394722#msg4394722 date=1388770766]
You must be using my system. The system loads the items depending if a player loads into a region that the item should spawn in
[/quote]

This is Hyperion, are you sure?[/quote]Didn’t know hyperion had a global item system via XML. Never mind then, unless someone ripped it.

Read full topic

item.title: Global Item Spawns on every level?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Still isn’t fixed but I found out that the items get spawned when the server starts up meaning that there are no players online when it initializes which probably leads to them being spawned on all levels.

Read full topic
item.source: Global Item Spawns on every level?

item.title: Global Item Spawns on every level?
item.dc:creator: @Dan0194 Dan0194
item.description:
@Dan0194 wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:6, topic:537968”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=656794.msg4394604#msg4394604 date=1388723017]

if(onHeightLevelIWant()){
Spawn();
}

Basically that.

I see but I’m loading them off an xml

So add another variable to your XML. Make a variable for height level.
Then check if the player’s height level is equal to the item’s height level, if so, the item exists, if not, it doesn’t
[/quote]

There is a variable for height.[/quote]
Every time you go to a new region just check if the player is on the appropriate region so like.

if(player.getZ() == globalDrops[i].getZ()) { getGlobalDropDefinition().loadArea(); }

Read full topic

item.source: Global Item Spawns on every level?

item.title: Global Item Spawns on every level?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

you should be checking/loading global items every time the region changes

when the region changes, if the player is on the z coordinate that the item is supposed to be on, then spawn the item. if not, don’t spawn the item (since the server -> client packet for spawning items doesn’t include the height).

“how can i check if the player is on the proper z coordinate” you should have some sort of list of all the active global items. if not then you’re out of luck and you’re probably gonna end up hardcoding your way out of this

“im not loading the z coordinate” use data encapsulation, you should be loading the x, y, and z coordinates

if you’re doing all of this already then i don’t know what the problem is

Read full topic
